bill_title: to affirm the right of a parent to have a traditional independent midwife present at the birth of a child.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to affirm the right of a parent to have a traditional independent midwife present at the birth of a child. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 36-2 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Nothing in this title limits the right of a parent to have present at the birth of a child a traditional independent midwife. A traditional independent midwife is a person who advises, attends, or assists women during pregnancy, labor, or natural childbirth, including the prenatal, intranatal, and postpartum periods of pregnancy. This right of a parent does not limit the right of any hospital or medical clinic to prescribe who may be in attendance at a birth which occurs within the hospital or medical clinic. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
